attributes.action: Bring back the A40 speed limit up to 40mph
attributes.additional_details:
We, the road users believe it is unreasonable to drive at such low speed at such wide road and for such an extensive drive. 
There are not a single house entrance or pedestrians/cyclists and therefore it has one elevation that cars would struggle in low gear and same when it goes down as it would require more breaking time using more breaking pads which we know cause more air pollution than the actual engines
attributes.background:
The speed limit between A40 nr Terrick and Paddington Grn used to be 40mph 
And it was reduced to 30mph which is way too little for such wide road without cyclists, pedestrians, businesses or houses. The length becomes monotonous and even difficult to concentrate on the actual driving.

rejection.details:
Not the Government/Parliament’s responsibility

We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local speed limits are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
